author: James
title: Mystery as tap water with foul smell and taste sparks alert in New Jersey drone hotspot
text:
Dozens of cities in New Jersey, home to more than a million people, have reported foul-smelling water flowing from their taps.
The complaints, which came to light Wednesday, prompted an â€œurgent notificationâ€ from New Jersey American Water, which is now investigating the Raritan system and surrounding areas.
The company took samples from the water source and several treatment plants and reported that â€œpreliminary sampling results showed that the water meets primary standards.â€
The Raritan system supplies drinking water to 64 cities in parts of Middlesex, Somerset and Union counties.
Customers in those areas received the notification at 9:30 PM ET, and an update is expected Thursday at 9:45 PM.
Residents have reported a metallic taste and an odor similar to paint thinner.
The contaminated tap water has led many on social media to speculate that drones flying over New Jersey may be linked to the changes, as the first sightings occurred over the Raritan River â€“ a vital resource for the Raritan system.
However, some residents have attributed the problems to a water main that broke in Union City at 7 a.m. Tuesday.
American Water did not specify whether the water main break was the cause of problems with the Raritan systemâ€™s water.
The Raritan system supplies drinking water to 64 cities in parts of Middlesex, Somerset and Union counties
The mystery has left many residents frustrated, with one person sharing on Reddit: â€˜Iâ€™m surprised theyâ€™re not giving any cluesâ€¦ is it safe to drink, touch skin, etc? Itâ€™s a bit strange that they leave out the most important information for the customer.â€™
American Water said it began flushing fire hydrants last night and continued through Thursday in an effort to help clear the system.
[This may result in low pressure and/or discoloration. If your water is discolored, run the cold-water taps only, at the lowest level of the house for about 3 to 5 minutes until the water runs clear,â€™ the company said in a press release.
Residents in Hillsborough, where a drone alleged crashed last week, and other towns have been told not to drink tap water and use bottled until further notice.
But as drones have invaded the skies over New Jersey for more than a month, conspiracy theories are swirling about the water changes.
â€˜So thereâ€™s been countless unidentified drones flying over our reservoirs completely unfettered, and now the water from an entire reservoir smells and tastes bad,â€™ a New Jersey resident shared online.
â€˜And they are 100% sure there is no connection, even though we donâ€™t know who is flying the drones, why the drones are flying, why they are over reservoirs, and why the water smells and tastes bad.â€™
A Facebook Group, New Jersey Mystery Drones â€“ letâ€™s solve it, features a thread about the mysterious water issues.
Dozens of New Jersey towns, home to over one million people, have reported foul-smelling and tasting water pouring from their taps
The tainted tap water has led many on social media to speculate that drones flying over New Jersey may be connected to the changes, as initial sightings occurred over the Raritan Riverâ€”a vital source for the Raritan System
A Hillsborough resident posted: â€˜This could be completely unrelated and I am hoping thatâ€™s the caseâ€¦.There are reports of foul smelling and tasting water in and around Hillsborough 08844. People are stating it tastes like nail polish. Any insight is appreciated.â€™
The first comment reads: â€˜Drones flying over reservoirs spraying stuff. Go figure. My country is run by idiots.â€™
Another New Jersey local shared the claims, saying: â€˜I seen this coming and warned everyone a couple days ago but everyone laughed at me.
â€˜Guess thatâ€™s what happens when Drones are seen spraying everywhere including water reservoirs.â€™
However, others commenting on the post sharing the issues with their tap water.
â€˜Over the past month Iâ€™ve had 2 distinctive occasions when Iâ€™ve came in from outside and told my wife I have a metallic taste in my mouth,â€™ one person shared.
While another said she was happy to have read the alert before bathing her one-year-old.
And many New Jerseyans warned the others to not drink the water.
Over the past month Iâ€™ve had 2 distinctive occasions when Iâ€™ve came in from outside and told my wife I have a metallic taste in my mouth.
While a mother said she was glad to read the post before bathing her baby with the smelly water.
The first New Jersey drone sightings appeared over the US Armyâ€™s Picatinny Arsenal on November 18.
Officials then started receiving reports of craft flying of water reservoirs, electric transmission lines, rail stations, police departments and military installations.
The White House has stated multiple times that it has â€˜not identified anything anomalous or any national security or public safety risk.â€™
National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said Tuesday that people are misidentifying hobbyists, planes, and even stars as drones.
He noted that the FBI had received tips on 5,000 drone sightings in recent weeks, of which 100 were deemed worthy of further investigation.

author: Ã–mer
title: Final warnings for Windows 10 from Microsoft!
text:
Microsoft has intensified full-screen ads to migrate Windows 10 users to Windows 11. Ahead of Windows 10 support ending on October 14, 2025, users are seeing ads on their devices highlighting the benefits of Windows 11.
Microsoftâ€™s insistence on Windows 11 for Windows 10 users
As it is known, Microsoft offers three options to users after the end of Windows 10 support. These are upgrading to Windows 11, receiving extended security updates in exchange for a subscription, or continuing to use Windows 10 without updates. Microsoftâ€™s ads primarily promote the transition to Windows 11, but do not provide enough information about other options.
Notably absent is any mention of the Extended Security Update (ESU) program, which allows individual users to receive security updates for another year for a fee. Corporate and education customers can benefit from this program for up to three years.
The ads also lack clear guidance on how to upgrade an existing device to Windows 11. This suggests that Microsoft is more interested in driving new PC sales than in encouraging users to upgrade. Itâ€™s worth noting that the ad strategy has been accelerating for a few months and users have been annoyed.
Still, Microsoft acknowledges that some users will stay on Windows 10 and recommends backing up files to OneDrive to avoid any problems. It seems possible that applications will also stop support for Windows 10 in the near future.
So what do you think about this issue? Donâ€™t forget to share your opinions with us in the comments section.

title: Perfume Nautica Voyage, en 310 pesos: lo MÃS VENDIDO en Mercado Libre
text:
En la bÃºsqueda de artÃ­culos de higiene personal y los mejores precios encontramos una oferta que no te puedes perder en el departamento de perfumerÃ­a y sÃ­, nos referimos a la fragancia de Nautica que puedes conseguir a un precio no creÃ­ble de 310 pesos mexicanos, algo que sin duda, no encontrarÃ¡s en una tienda departamental
Â¿CuÃ¡l es el perfume que podemos encontrar en 310 pesos? Nos referimos a la fragancia Nautica Voyage, la cuÃ¡l podrÃ¡s encontrar por tan solo 310 pesos en Mercado Libre, no hay margen de error, es un precio Ãºnico e irrepetible.
SÃ TE INTERESA DA CLICK AQUÃ
Nautica, la marca estadounidense conocida por su estilo nÃ¡utico y su ropa deportiva clÃ¡sica, ha dejado una huella imborrable en la moda global desde su fundaciÃ³n hace mÃ¡s de cuatro dÃ©cadas. Su historia estÃ¡ marcada por la visiÃ³n de un diseÃ±ador innovador y los cambios de propiedad que la han llevado a ser parte de un conglomerado lÃ­der en marcas lifestyle. AquÃ­ exploramos quiÃ©n creÃ³ Nautica y quiÃ©n es su dueÃ±o actual, en un recorrido que combina creatividad y estrategia empresarial. LEER MÃS: AsÃ­ funciona la IA de TaDa Delivery en pedidos abandonados Â¿QuiÃ©n creÃ³ Nautica? Nautica fue fundada en 1983 por David Chu, un diseÃ±ador estadounidense de origen taiwanÃ©s nacido en 1955. Chu creciÃ³ en Nueva York y Connecticut tras la inmigraciÃ³n de su familia en la dÃ©cada de 1960. Inicialmente, su sueÃ±o era ser arquitecto, pero su destino cambiÃ³ tras tomar un curso de dibujo en el Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT). Un profesor, impresionado por su talento, lo alentÃ³ a diseÃ±ar ropa, y Chu encontrÃ³ su vocaciÃ³n. Graduado del FIT, donde fue nombrado alumno estrella en 1996, Chu se inspirÃ³ en los abrigos de los marineros para crear una lÃ­nea de ropa que combinara funcionalidad y estilo. AsÃ­ naciÃ³ Nautica, un nombre derivado del latÃ­n â€œnauticusâ€ (naval), que reflejaba su amor por el mar y la estÃ©tica marinera. En 1984, la marca fue adquirida por State-O-Maine, una empresa de Nueva York que luego adoptÃ³ el nombre Nautica, consolidando su Ã©xito inicial en tiendas como Barneys y Bloomingdaleâ€™s. Â¿QuiÃ©n es el dueÃ±o de Nautica? Desde abril de 2018, Nautica pertenece a Authentic Brands Group (ABG), una compaÃ±Ã­a de desarrollo y gestiÃ³n de marcas con sede en Nueva York. ABG adquiriÃ³ Nautica de VF Corporation, que la habÃ­a comprado en 2003 por 586 millones de dÃ³lares, en una transacciÃ³n cuyo valor no fue revelado. Bajo el liderazgo de Jamie Salter, presidente y CEO de ABG, la empresa administra un portafolio de mÃ¡s de 50 marcas icÃ³nicas, incluyendo Sports Illustrated, Juicy Couture y Brooks Brothers, generando cerca de 25,000 millones de dÃ³lares en ventas globales anuales. La compra de Nautica marcÃ³ un hito para ABG, fortaleciendo su presencia en el segmento de moda lifestyle de gama media alta. Desde entonces, ABG ha reposicionado a Nautica como una marca moderna y accesible, enfocada en ropa deportiva y athleisure, mientras mantiene su esencia nÃ¡utica. David Chu, tras vender Nautica, continuÃ³ su carrera en la moda, asociÃ¡ndose con marcas como Georg Jensen, pero su creaciÃ³n sigue resonando en el mercado. Con ABG al mando, Nautica opera en mÃ¡s de 65 paÃ­ses, con 72 tiendas propias en EE.UU., 291 internacionales y mÃ¡s de 1,400 puntos de venta. La marca ha diversificado su oferta con accesorios, relojes y fragancias, manteniendo su atractivo global. Este binomio entre el genio creativo de Chu y la estrategia de ABG asegura que Nautica navegue hacia un futuro prometedor, adaptÃ¡ndose a las tendencias sin perder su identidad marinera. â‡’ SUSCRÃBETE A NUESTROS CONTENIDOS EN GOOGLE NEWS

author: Jon Moss | jmoss@syracuse.com
title: Man killed by troopers after he opened fire on NY State Police barracks in Saratoga County
text:
Malta, N.Y. â€” Troopers fatally shot a man who opened fire Wednesday on a State Police barracks in the Capital Region, officials said.
The man arrived at about 1:45 p.m. at the barracks in Malta in Saratoga County, according to a news release from Stephanie Oâ€™Neil, a spokesperson for the State Police.
He fired several rounds at the building from a hunting-style rifle.
Troopers rushed out of the building and returned fire, killing the man, Oâ€™Neil said.
The man was not immediately identified.
There is no threat to the public, Oâ€™Neil said.
Staff writer Jon Moss covers breaking news, crime and public safety. He can be reached at jmoss@syracuse.com or @mossjon7.
